alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 05 at 11:18AM EST until further notice by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... White River at Petersburg. Wabash River from Mount Carmel to Montezuma. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Hazleton. .Ongoing flooding continues on the White River at Petersburg, and most of the Wabash River from Montezuma downstream. Both rivers have crested and are receding. Flooding on the lower portions of the Wabash and White rivers is currently forecast to last well into next week, but could be extended based on expected rainfall this weekend into early next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 21.3 feet, State Road 257 south of Washington began to flood during May 2008 after local rains of more than an inch on very wet soils with Petersburg at 21.3 feet and rising and Shoals at 15.5 feet and rising. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Saturday /9:30 AM CST Saturday/ the stage was 17.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EST Saturday /9:30 AM CST Saturday/ was 19.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this morning by around 1100 AM CST /1200 PM EST/.
